transcript.text: [Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x 22
report my name is dave and this is
episode 1146 a and today's date is
December 7 2016 and the title of the
episode is time is now the enemy of the
central bankers as the illusion of a
healthy economy disappears let's get
into the economic collapse financial
news today we can see the market is
rapidly moving higher now we kind of
expect this at this point we know the
existing administration the central
bank's they're going to create this
illusion and we've been seeing it unfold
right in front of our eyes they're going
to create this illusion where people are
going to be sucked in into believing
that everything is perfect they want
this to happen this is part of their
agenda they want people to believe that
they have completely recovered the
economy now we've been looking at other
information not the stock market we look
at the statistical information that the
government puts out but we look very
very closely at it and we find out that
most of it is fake phony and false a lot
of it they manipulate a lot of revisions
and we can see right now their illusion
is falling apart time is against them
right now the VLS put out a report and
they are saying that the number of job
openings right now well they've dropped
from the upward revised September print
which is 5.6 3 million to 5.5 3 million
that's down some like 97,000 and the job
openings right now they're in a serious
decline so what does this mean it means
the US labor market is rolling over
despite the near record number of job
openings the pace of hiring has failed
to keep up and I discussed the job
openings once before in these huge
corporations they have these open rex
each department gets them and they don't
like to lose them because they're very
difficult to get back so what they do is
they interview people now a lot of times
companies put freezes on hiring or you
make it so difficult that no one can
ever fill that position but you want the
wreck open because you know you're going
to use it maybe some time in the future
when things get better and a lot of
companies what they do is they'll
interview people they'll keep the job
Rex open they'll show that there's a job
opening but they have no way of filling
it they're not going to fill it and
they're just trying to keep that wreck
open and this is what we're seeing right
now but what we're seeing is that the
annual rate of change in hiring drop
below two-point-two percent compared to
the 5.2 million a year ago this was the
biggest contraction in hiring since
march of 2013 and what we're seeing when
we look at this this happened in the
year of 2007 going into 2008 and then
the economy came crashing down and we're
starting to see the same exact thing
once again and we can see that people
are still having a very difficult time
finding work many people have reduced
salaries many people have gotten
part-time jobs once they had a full-time
job but they still wonderful time job
all they can find is a part-time job and
this is showing up in many different
areas of the economy one being retail to
being the restaurant industry three
being in real estate and we know that
the real the restaurant performance
index
well that has been dropping traffic has
been drawing up in restaurants we also
see according to a restaurant tracker
NPD group traffic at us fast food
restaurants they fell by 1% in the third
quarter the sector's first traffic
decline in five years now the reason is
not that many Americans have migrated to
a higher wealth group and now they're
eating more expensive meals what's
happening right now is that going to
these fast-food restaurants they're
becoming too costly for many people
remember salaries are declining people
are coming from full-time to part-time
jobs and the MPD survey found that
seventy five percent of respondents said
they have to cut back on restaurant
dining as they keep a closer tab on
spending in most of all their purchases
and they're saying that right now
restaurants fast-food restaurants
they're just too expensive and they're
bypassing them and we realize that this
has been going on for quite a while now
and it started in retail it spread to
housing and we knew eventually it would
come to the restaurant industry and then
eventually the fast-food industry
because it's a trickle-down effect where
everyone is going to be affected by this
and as more and more people can't find
jobs as more and more people go from a
full-time job get laid off and go to a
part-time job we're going to see more of
this this is why what the US government
what the central bankers are telling us
that the unemployment rate is at four
point six percent is absolutely
ridiculous it makes no sense whatsoever
because again when you see an economy
doing well and unemployment is so low
you see the economy expand you don't see
it contract you don't see retail stores
getting ready to lay off 5,000 jobs
during a holiday season
I know they put on temporary workers but
those individuals that thought they had
a job they're going to be let go right
after the holiday season along with all
the temporary workers and we see in the
housing industry well that's starting to
completely fall apart remember the
bubbles have reached the top they are
coming down right now I'm seeing more
and more homes on the market people are
reducing their prices the interest rates
are entering up a little bit and just
think about this is just a small little
increase what a gigantic effect that has
on the real estate market can you
imagine what would happen if these times
were normal the real estate market would
come crashing down why do you think
they've been keeping the interest rates
near zero negative in Europe negative in
Japan because they know and we're seeing
that mortgage applications they're down
for the second week in a row and they
dip by 0.7% and the week ending December
second and the situation is not getting
better it's getting worse now we know
that banks they've been caught
manipulating the interest rate they've
been caught manipulating the precious
metals and we see that the European
Commission has fine JP Morgan HSBC about
485 million euros for rigging the Euro
bore benchmark as European Union
antitrust regulators they wrapped up a
five-year investigation into the scandal
three banks colluded on euro interest
rate derivative pricing elements and
exchange sensitive information in breach
of EU antitrust rules it's amazing how
these banks continually manipulate the
market they're caught they pay this
small little nothing fine and they
continually manipulate I mean everyone
should be out there going this is
absolutely ridiculous these banks people
should go to jail but no one does we see
Italian Prime Minister Renzi he said he
wasn't going to resign and now he is
resigning after the approval of the
budget bill we see the Italian
government well they're preparing to
nationalize monte dei paschi and they
realize there is nothing else they can
do and they're going to be taking
control of this Bank it'll be a
state-owned bank they will have a huge
interest in this and it's going to be
about forty percent of the bank and we
can see right now that the situation
throughout Europe is getting worse and
worse as time goes on here in the United
States the economy is getting worse and
worse as time goes on and we know that
everything that the corporate media is
putting out there is fake and phony when
it has to do with the recovery they're
building this up because as we know
Obama is going to leave office Trump's
going to come in and the central bankers
they're getting ready to bring the whole

saying that the economy most likely will

administration now many individuals are
saying this I had a discussion with
vicks we're on the x 22 report spotlight
youtube channel and he said the same
thing that most likely this economy is

administration and i don't think we're

because they're they don't want to wait
for some type of an event which they
can't control the system coming down
they want to bring it down they want to
blame it on either Trump or maybe Russia
or another group and we can see right
now they're preparing to do this
and when this system comes down well
it's gonna come down hard and fast it's
not going to be a slow drawn out thing
we can see right now the patterns are
pretty much the same during 1929 during
2008 and now now right before the crash
the market hits all-time new highs to

bring it down they stop the life support
and the whole thing just collapses
because there's no purpose right now
into dragging this out because the
Middle East is lost the petrodollar is
doomed the system has so much debt it
cannot be sustained they know that these

they can't support the debt and the job

they know without people having work
there's nothing they can do with this

interest rates are already down to zero
the only thing left is to bring the

you
